title: Nightmare scenario: How Iran, hit by US, may choke world’s oil supply - explained
content: Iran-Israel war: Amidst rising tensions, concerns escalate over potential disruptions to global oil supply via the Strait of Hormuz. While a prolonged blockade remains unlikely, even brief closures could trigger significant price surges and economic instability. Iran's strategic position offers various retaliatory options, yet faces constraints including potential counterstrikes and disapproval from key allies like China.

title: Decoy plan, 125 planes: How US carried out largest B-2 strike in history
content: Under Operation Midnight Hammer, American stealth bombers executed a surprise strike on Iran's underground nuclear facilities. Seven B-2 Spirit bombers flew from Missouri, dropping bunker-buster bombs on key sites like Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan. The mission aimed to cripple Iran's uranium enrichment program, with US officials hailing it as a major success, despite Iran's denial and vow to retaliate.

title: Elon Musk’s simple life: World’s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: IND vs ENG: Bumrah's wife shares adorable photo of son - see pic
content: Sanjana Ganesan, Jasprit Bumrah's wife, shared an Instagram story featuring a child, presumably their son Angad, holding a cricket ball marked with Bumrah's impressive figures from the first Test against England. Bumrah's stellar performance at Headingley saw him claim a five-wicket haul, finishing with 5/83, despite India's mixed bowling performance and dropped catches.

title: DGCA starts inspection of Air India's main hub; surveillance planned before crash: Officials
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation will assess Air India's Gurugram facility. This evaluation will check aircraft documents and crew records. It is a standard yearly activity, not a response to the Ahmedabad crash.

title: Man who lost 2 loved ones in air crashes years apart; in 1988, then daughter in AI plane crash
content: Ahmedabad businessman Saurin Palkhiwala faces tragedy again with the Air India Flight 171 crash, losing his 26-year-old daughter, Sanjana. He tragically recalls a similar loss in 1988. Sanjana, born after 14 years of marriage, was a bright BBA and NYU graduate, traveling to the UK for a reunion.

title: LinkedIn CEO on AI killing jobs: There’s going to be a disruption; AI will also ...
content: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky believes AI will disrupt work but ultimately create more opportunities, similar to the Industrial Revolution. He highlights the growing demand for AI literacy and human-AI collaboration skills. Roslansky and LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman emphasize the importance of continuous learning and adapting to evolving job requirements in the age of AI.

title: Kaavia James dances to Bollywood hit; fans call it ‘cutest moment’ - video
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: ‘Not fit to fly, go stitch slippers’: IndiGo trainee pilot alleges casteist abuse
content: An FIR has been filed against three IndiGo Airlines officials following accusations of caste-based harassment and humiliation by a trainee pilot. The complainant alleges verbal abuse and discriminatory behavior during a meeting at the company's Gurgaon office. The FIR, initially filed in Bengaluru, includes charges under the SC/ST Act and BNS, prompting a police investigation into the allegations

title: US hits Iran: Egg on Pak's face day after backing Trump for peace Nobel
content: Pakistan's nomination of Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize backfired after US airstrikes on Iran, creating a diplomatic crisis for Islamabad. The move sparked domestic backlash and accusations of inconsistency, especially after the government condemned the attacks. This incident highlights the challenges of balancing relations with the US amid regional tensions and strong public support for Iran.

title: 'Wow, a lot...': How Bill Gates reacted when daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: US-Iran tensions: Tehran vows 'proportionate response' - key ways it can retaliate
content: Following the US obliteration of Iranian nuclear facilities, Iran vows a "proportionate response," leaving the world on edge. Tehran faces a dilemma: retaliate credibly without igniting a regional war. Options range from calibrated strikes on US bases and economic warfare via the Strait of Hormuz to cyberattacks, with the potential for delayed action or a shift towards nuclear armament.

title: Bus horror in Kolkata: Woman journalist molested; accused arrested, gets bail
content: In Kolkata, a woman journalist faced a harrowing experience on a bus when a co-passenger, Sanjay Basak, allegedly molested and assaulted her. The accused, who was occupying a seat reserved for women, subjected her to inappropriate touching and verbal abuse.

title: Inter-caste marriage ends in murder: Jaipur man killed in daylight; in-laws suspected
content: In Jaipur, Govind Prajapat was brutally murdered allegedly by his in-laws due to their disapproval of his inter-caste marriage to Payal Saini. The 27-year-old was ambushed on his way to work and killed with a stone.

title: Covid-19 resurges in country: New variant spreads rapidly; this common symptom could be key indicator
content: Nimbus (NB.1.8.1) is a descendant of the Omicron variant, and was first detected in January 2025. Since then, it has spread quickly across many countries, including the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, India, and parts of Asia. However, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) the variant remains mild as of now, and does not cause severe illness.

title: 'Show moral courage': Cong slams Centre; criticises Trump for Iran strikes
content: The Congress party has strongly condemned US President Trump's airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, calling it a contradiction to his calls for dialogue. They criticized the Indian government's silence on the US bombing, Israel's actions, and the situation in Gaza.

title: Language row at Nilgiris station: DMK's A Raja urges Hindi banner removal; cites Tamil pride
content: DMK's A Raja has urged Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to remove Hindi banners from the Nilgiris railway station. Raja contends that the increased use of Hindi disregards Tamil Nadu's linguistic identity and violates the state's two-language policy.

title: 'Bullseye': Trump hails op Midnight Hammer, says 'monumental damage' done to Iran
content: Donald Trump claimed that recent US airstrikes, dubbed 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' inflicted significant damage on Iran's nuclear facilities. He asserted that satellite imagery confirms the obliteration of nuclear sites, particularly the Fordow facility, targeted with Massive Ordnance Penetrators. Trump emphasized the unique capability of the US military in executing such a complex operation.

title: Adin Ross returns with Brand Risk 008: Date, full fight card revealed
content: Adin Ross is set to host Brand Risk 008 in Nashville on June 22, 2025, featuring a main event between Charleston White and Kodiyakredd. The event, streamed live on Kick, includes nine influencer matchups with personalities like Scam Likely, Julian Newman, and Supreme Patty. Following a chaotic Brand Risk 007, expect more drama and unexpected moments.

title: 'She's heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: OTD: India won the 2013 ICC Champions Trophy, and Dhoni created history
content: On this day in 2013, India, captained by MS Dhoni, clinched the ICC Champions Trophy by defeating England in a thrilling final at Edgbaston. Reduced to 20 overs due to rain, India posted 129/7, thanks to Kohli and Jadeja's crucial partnership.

title: NBA Finals: TJ McConnell pens emotional note after crushing Game 7 loss; receives online support
content: T.J. McConnell apologized to Indiana Pacers fans after their heartbreaking Game 7 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder in the NBA Finals. Despite McConnell's valiant effort stepping in for the injured Tyrese Haliburton, the Pacers fell short of securing their first title. Pascal Siakam echoed McConnell's sentiments, expressing the team's desire to win for the city and its devoted fans.

title: Bumrah makes WTC history, becomes first seamer to reach huge milestone
content: Jasprit Bumrah etched his name in cricket history during the first Test against England, securing his 11th five-wicket haul in the World Test Championship, equaling Ravichandran Ashwin's record. He also became the first Asian player to claim 150 Test wickets in SENA countries, surpassing Wasim Akram.

title: 'Big mistake': Khamenei again warns Israel of 'punishment'; no mention of US strike
content: Ayatollah Khamenei warned Israel of punishment amidst US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, though he didn't directly mention the US action. Iran vowed a proportionate response, potentially targeting US bases, and accused the US of sabotaging diplomacy. Trump defended the strikes, hinting at regime change, while Israel claimed progress in eliminating Iran's nuclear capabilities.

title: Price prediction: What's gold rate outlook for June 23 week amid Israel-Iran war- buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices experienced volatility last week amid escalating geopolitical tensions between Iran and Israel, coupled with a steady dollar. Gold prices are expected to trade sideways to positive, with support at ₹97,000-₹98,000 and resistance at ₹100,000-₹100,100.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 dips below 24,900; BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in opening trade on Monday following global cues. While Nifty50 went below 25,000, BSE Sensex was down over 600 points.

title: IND vs ENG: Could Pant face ICC ban after heated clash over ball change?
content: Rishabh Pant faces potential ICC sanctions after an on-field incident at Headingley. Pant's frustration over an umpire's decision regarding a ball change request led to a heated exchange and him throwing the ball in protest. Former coach Ravi Shastri attributed Pant's actions to frustration, while co-commentator Mark Butcher questioned the need for such behavior.

title: Fire erupts on 'Anupamaa' Set: Halts shoot at Goregaon Film City; no casualties reported
content: A fire erupted on the set of the popular TV show Anupamaa in Mumbai's Film City early Monday morning, causing significant damage. The All Indian Cine Workers Association confirmed the set was destroyed, but thankfully, no casualties were reported. The incident occurred before the scheduled shoot, with crew members present.

title: Honeymoon murder: Raja Raghuvanshi's bag destroyed; auto driver link in probe
content: In the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case, Shillong police, aided by Indore Crime Branch, recovered the charred remains of a bag linked to the crime from a vacant plot. Accused Silom, a property dealer, admitted to burning the bag with the help of Balvindar, a security guard.

title: NASA spots Japan’s Resilience crash site: High-res image shows impact, private moon missions struggle
content: NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter has spotted the crash site of Japan's Resilience moon lander. The ispace lander aimed for a historic landing in Mare Frigoris. Communication was lost during descent. The image shows a dark smudge, indicating a high-speed impact. A microrover carrying art was also lost. This marks ispace's second failed lunar landing.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant’s ‘apne chauke ke chakkar mein…’ quip to Jadeja leaves everyone laughing - watch video
content: India and England are locked in a thrilling first Test at Headingley, marked by Pant's century and Bumrah's record-equalling five-wicket haul. England responded strongly, but India fought back, setting up a tense Day 4. With India leading by 96 runs, the match hangs in the balance, promising more drama as weather and aggressive batting add to the excitement.

title: NBA Champions: Shai Gilgeous‑Alexander clinches title; Leads thunder to historic Game7 title
content: Oklahoma City Thunder secured their first NBA title since 2008, defeating the Indiana Pacers 103-91 in Game 7. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, named Finals MVP, led the Thunder with 29 points. Gilgeous-Alexander also achieved the rare feat of winning both regular season and Finals MVP. The Thunder's victory marks a historic moment, showcasing their dominant season and young, championship-caliber roster.

title: 'Bustling with activity': Omar Abdullah hails 'revival' of tourism in Pahalgam
content: Omar Abdullah reports a resurgence in Kashmir tourism. Pahalgam, once deserted, now thrives with tourists and locals. This revival follows a terror attack in April. Efforts to restore tourism are yielding positive results. Abdullah expresses satisfaction with the progress. The region is experiencing renewed activity and interest. The return of tourists signals a positive shift for the local economy.

title: 2025 NBA Finals Prize Money: How much did Oklahoma City Thunder & Indiana Pacers earn? Check full breakdown
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder clinched their first NBA championship since 1979, defeating the Indiana Pacers in a thrilling seven-game series. The Thunder's victory earned them a total of $12.42 million, resulting in $828,000 for each player. The Pacers, as runners-up, secured $5.79 million from the league's prize pool, contributing to the overall $34.7 million distributed among playoff teams.

title: NBA trade rumors: Bulls eye $60M Celtics star Kristaps Porzingis; 3-team deal may save Boston $140M
content: Fresh off their NBA championship, the Boston Celtics face a crucial offseason decision regarding Kristaps Porzingis. Trading him could save the team up to $140 million in luxury tax, offering long-term financial flexibility. However, losing Porzingis would weaken their frontcourt and potentially diminish their 2025 title chances, forcing a difficult choice between immediate contention and future sustainability.

title: Watch: B-2 bombers land in US after strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities
content: US B-2 Spirit bombers, returning to Missouri's Whiteman Air Force base, concluded a 36-hour mission in the CENTCOM area. As part of 'Operation Midnight Hammer,' seven stealth aircraft executed a precision strike on Iranian nuclear facilities, deploying 30,000-pound bunker-buster bombs. American officials claim the mission devastated Iran's nuclear program, while Iran denies significant damage and vows retaliation, escalating regional tensions.

title: 'Why wouldn't there be a regime change?': Trump drops 'hint' after US hits n-sites in Iran
content: Donald Trump seemingly endorsed regime change in Iran, questioning why it wouldn't occur if the current regime fails to improve the nation. This contrasts with his administration's earlier statements, where officials like JD Vance, Marco Rubio, and Pete Hegseth asserted that the recent US air strikes on Iranian nuclear sites were not aimed at toppling the government.

title: Double trouble: AI asked to remove 3 crew officials & gets show-cause for violating pilot flying hour norms
content: Following the tragic Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has directed Air India to remove three senior officials from crew scheduling roles. The crash, involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, resulted in 241 fatalities.

title: US issues 'worldwide caution' as Iran vows 'proportionate' response to strikes
content: Following US military strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, a global security alert has been issued for American citizens. The State Department, citing potential reprisals, ordered non-essential staff to leave Lebanon and issued advisories for Türkiye and Saudi Arabia. Iran has vowed a 'proportionate response,' raising fears of a wider conflict as Israeli air raids continue and Tehran threatens US allies.

title: Punjab horror: Property dealer shoots wife, teenage son, dies by suicide
content: In a tragic incident near Changera village, Sandeep Singh Rajpal allegedly shot his wife, Mandeep Kaur, and their son, Abhay, before committing suicide. The bodies were discovered inside their SUV by workers near Banur-Tepla road. Police found a pistol in Sandeep's hand and are investigating the motive, though mental health issues of the son are known.

title: Karisma Kapoor joins Sunjay Kapur’s wife in prayer meet; Kareena, Saif and others offer support
content: Karisma Kapoor was seen offering prayers alongside Priya Sachdev, the current wife of her late ex-husband Sunjay Kapur, at an emotional prayer meet held in Delhi. The solemn gathering took place on June 22 at the Taj Palace Hotel, following Sunjay’s untimely demise on June 12 during a polo match in England. He was 53.

title: IND vs ENG: Manjrekar forgets Kohli as Gill’s celebration sparks déjà vu!- Watch
content: Shubman Gill, in his Test captaincy debut, displayed a passionate leadership style reminiscent of Virat Kohli during the match against England. His animated celebration after a perceived dismissal of Joe Root, later overturned by DRS, sparked commentary about his transformed on-field demeanor.

title: 97 'anti-nationals' arrested post Pahalgam terror attack in Assam: Himanta
content: The arrested person from Tinsukia had shared objectionable content on Hinduism on social media, while the accused from Nagaon made a derogatory comment on Lord Ram, the CM said

title: Police nab wanted murder accused after encounter in Gwalior
content: “The accused Bunty Bhadoria sustained a bullet injury in his leg after the police fired at him in retaliation during a chase,” an official said

title: Two Srisailam temple staff suspended for ‘negligence’
content: Following complaint that the bags were kept with the cashier against norms, an internal enquiry was conducted following which action has been initiated against the two officials for their negligence.

title: Sustainability is a necessity, not a slogan anymore: President Droupadi Murmu
content: The President also said the time is over for corporate organisations to act solely with the objective of earning profits, and now they have to keep the environmental costs in mind

title: Indore-Bhubaneswar IndiGo flight delayed due to technical snag
content: Pilots of the IndiGo flight number '6E 6332' noticed a technical snag when the plane was heading towards the runway for take-off, an official said.

title: Tirupparankundram row: Madras High Court dismisses H. Raja’s plea against police notice summoning him for inquiry
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs the BJP leader to appear before the Inspector of Subramaniapuram police in Madurai city and cooperate with the investigation

title: Don't politicise anti-Naxal operations; conduct them in transparent manner: Congress leader Sachin Pilot
content: Sachin Pilot said everyone should come together to end Naxalism not only in Chhattisgarh but also in other States which have been struggling with the menace

title: Nilambur bypoll: P.V. Anvar factor cannot be ignored, says KPCC president Sunny Joseph
content: ‘We will examine whether any UDF votes shifted to Anvar. A person who has received so many votes cannot be disregarded,’ says Sunny Joseph

title: PM Modi, BJP leaders pay tributes to Syama Prasad Mookerjee on death anniversary
content: An early champion of repealing Article 370, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir, Syama Prasad Mookerjee joined hands with the RSS to launch Jana Sangh in 1951

title: Odisha plans to ease forest, wildlife restrictions to boost tourism; experts call it dangerous
content: Experts say Odisha's move could allow economic interests to shape regulatory frameworks meant for ecological protection and mark a dangerous departure from India's legal and ecological commitments

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Congress asks government to show moral courage, slams it for not condemning U.S. bombing
content: The U.S. attack on the Iranian nuclear facilities has triggered fears of a wider regional conflict, with many leading countries and blocs calling for restraint.

title: Samajwadi Party expels three MLAs for anti-party activities, deviating from core principles
content: Those expelled from the party are Abhay Singh (MLA from Gosainganj), Rakesh Pratap Singh (Gauriganj) and Manoj Kumar Pandey (Unchahar), the SP said in an official statement

title: Shahapur drinking water project to be inaugurated by Karnataka CM in August
content: Apart from Shahapur city, two villages – Ingalagi and Madnal – will also get the water from the project

title: 3,000-MW power project to come up in Dhubri or Goalpara: Himanta
content: ‘The Assam govt had mooted allocating the project to Kokrajhar so that it can reap benefits of a major investment, which is set to create one lakh direct and indirect employment opportunities,’ says CM Himanta

title: Woman kills daughter, ends life after husband transfers land to relative in Karnataka
content: Preliminary investigations indicated that Mala took the extreme step after her husband transferred 10 guntas of land to a relative after a discussion with his mother and brother

title: Seeing blue: The Isle by Wonderla is a water-themed resort on the edge of Bengaluru
content: The pet-friendly resort has tropical style cottages with jacuzzies, a spa and a lagoon that runs through the property

title: Protesting students at Haryana Agricultural University adamant on demand to remove VC
content: The protesting students have accused the VC of “brutal repression” and “suppression of rights”, claiming that he ordered lathi charge on students

title: Commuters have a harrowing time at Ernakulam Junction railway station as redevelopment works hit a dead end
content: ₹300-crore station redevelopment project hits a dead end; acute space constraints, waterlogging and undulation within the station premises cause inconvenience to passengers; steps to relocate vendors near the station sought

title: Private medical colleges in Telangana credit ₹25,000 stipend, take back ₹20,000 in cash, allege MBBS students
content: Speaking to The Hindu, interns from multiple private institutions detailed disturbing practices employed by the administrations to create an illusion of compliance.

title: Dropped from Goa Cabinet after alleging graft in CM-led dept., Gaude ratchets up attack
content: Former Minister Govind Gaude says he will not resign as MLA or quit BJP and continue to work for tribal people

title: Assembly bypoll results LIVE updates: UDF’s Aryadan Shoukath wrests Nilambur; AAP takes wide lead in Visavadar
content: Trinamool Congress’ Alifa Ahamed leads by over 19,000 votes in the bye-election to the Kaliganj assembly seat in West Bengal

title: Claims of U.S. using Indian airspace debunked by PIB Fact Check
content: It said that the Joint Chiefs of Staff Chair Gen. Dan Caine had explained the route used by U.S. aircraft during a press briefing

title: Tripura government gives jobs to 18 next of kin of victims murdered in political violence
content: The primary consideration for recruitment is based on the financial condition of the families, but all those lost kin would also be considered in the next phases

title: Anti-Hindu forces using freedom of speech as a shield: Pawan Kalyan
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan calls out ‘pseudo-secularists’; says tolerance, patience of Hindus should not be mistaken for cowardice

title: U.S. travel advisory warns citizens of crime, rape, terrorism in India, urges ‘increased caution’
content: The advisory says the U.S. government has limited ability to provide emergency services to its citizens in rural areas, which stretch from eastern Maharashtra and northern Telangana through western West Bengal

title: TGPSC Group-1 rankers urge Telangana govt. to clear appointment hurdles
content: Commission announced 563 vacancies for recruitment but the High Court in April temporarily halted it after a writ petition was filed over allegations of irregularities in evaluation process

title: NIA nabs one more in Maoist revival conspiracy case
content: The agency also seized digital devices, including hard drives, pen drives, and mobile phones, as well as other “incriminating” material during a search in the West Delhi house of the accused person identified as Vishal Singh, originally from Uttar Pradesh’s Mathura.

title: Tiruvannamalai Corporation to build multi-level car parks for pilgrims near Arunachaleshwara temple
content: Officials say the civic body has selected at least five spots near Mada Streets around the temple for the new facilities. A nominal fee will be charged for the use of the facilities.

title: Meet Jency, Tamil Nadu’s first transwoman to become assistant professor at college
content:
Ms. Jency is the first transgender to become an assistant professor at Loyola College. A native of R.K. Pet in 
Tiruttani, she completed schooling and under-graduation at government institutions. She did her Ph.D at Loyola College

title: Anti-Naxal campaigns to continue in monsoon: Amit Shah
content: “Lay down arms and join the journey of development; no need for talks, just give up armed struggle and join the mainstream,” Home Minister tells Naxals; he reiterates the March 2026 deadline for the elimination of Naxalism in the country

title: Former A.P. CM Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy named accused in hit-and-run case: Guntur police
content: The incident occurred during Mr. Reddy’s tour programme on June 18, for which police had permitted only the former CM’s convoy and three cars to travel from Tadepalli to Sattenapalli.

title: INS Tamal, India’s last imported warship, to be commissioned on July 1
content: The ceremony will be presided over by Western Naval Commander Vice Admiral Sanjay J. Singh in the presence of several high-ranking Indian and Russian government and defence officials.

title: Seven lakes in Shivamogga to be developed for water sports
content: Balligavi Basavannana Kere, Doopadahalli Doddakere, Talagunda Hirekere, all from Shikaripur taluk; Keladi Kere from Sagar taluk; Kubaturu Kere in Sorab taluk; Humcha Mutthina Kere in Hosanagar taluk, and Gopishetty Koppa Doddakere in Shivamogga taluk have been identified for development

title: Scheduled Caste man assaulted, his hut vandalised in Mayiladuthurai
content: The attack stemmed from the resentment among members of the Most Backward Community (MBC) against the only Scheduled Caste house at Mela Manganallur in Mayiladuthurai district

title: ECI considers intensive house to house verification to update electoral rolls before Bihar Assembly election
content: Persistent concerns have been raised by various civil society organisations, political parties, and agencies on the inclusion or deletion of names of electors from the electoral rolls

title: Village in Etah on edge after clash over Dalit marriage
content: Marriage procession of a Dalit family was obstructed and allegedly attacked by some individuals of dominant caste; local Dalits alleged of facing threats and inaction by police.

title: AMMA to hold election in three months
content: At a meeting on Sunday, actor Mohanlal reportedly refuses to take up presidency of the organisation

title: ₹3,858 crore allocated for development of 448 km of four-lane roads under the Chief Minister’s Road Development Scheme since 2021
content: A sum of ₹2,207 crore has been allocated for the development of 1,681 km of two-lane roads, says the Highways Department

title: Infrastructure deficiencies, low funds affecting organ transplants: report
content: Only 13,476 kidney transplants were performed against the recommended 1 lakh cases last year, says report

title: We shouldn't expect smooth sailing all time: Jaishankar on India's ties with neighbours
content: The Minister said one of the "really perplexing" aspects of India's China policy was the "complete neglect of our border infrastructure in the previous decades"

title: Narrow lanes, no median on RK Puram flyover makes commuting a gamble
content: Crucial link for thousands of daily commuters travelling towards Trimulgherry, Karkhana and Secunderabad, the flyover has become a symbol of urban neglect with narrow lanes and no central barricade separating the two directions of traffic

title: Palaniswami criticises DMK government for  ‘lack of industrial development’
content: Citing figures from a report of the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade for 2024-25, he says that while Maharashtra and Karnataka took the first two positions in foreign direct investment, Tamil Nadu was placed fifth

title: NGT notice to CPCB, Bihar authorities over rise in lightning deaths due to felling of palm trees
content: According to a newspaper report, after the ban on toddy tapping due to Bihar's prohibition policy, palm trees lost their economic value and have since been widely cut down

title: Delay in transmission lines stalls railway electrification progress on Bengaluru-Mysuru-Mangaluru route
content: According to officials, SWR could save up to ₹4.36 crore every month by switching eight pairs of trains on this section from diesel to electric traction.

title: Nilambur result crucial for LDF, UDF ahead of upcoming polls
content: Both fronts claim that the electoral fight is mainly between them. However, they are reportedly apprehensive about the campaigns of the BJP and P.V. Anvar upsetting their duopoly in Nilambur via covert tactical voting in key panchayats

title: Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary calls Lalu Prasad ‘Gabbar’ of Bihar
content: The BJP leader defends Chief Minister Nitish Kumar over the repeated attacks by Opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav and terms Kumar a ‘conscious’ leader

title: A.P. records 37.5% deficit rainfall between June 1 and 22
content: Except for Eluru, Krishna, Kurnool, Anantapur, East Godavari, which reported ‘normal’ rainfall during the period, the remaining 21 districts reported ‘deficit’ rainfall

title: OKC takes Game 7, caps historic season with title
content: Oklahoma City capped a historically dominant regular season by becoming the second-youngest champion.

title: SGA named MVP, but it was 'a win for everyone'
content: Oklahoma City star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander put the finishing touches on one of the most impressive individual seasons in NBA history by hoisting the Bill Russell Trophy, awarded to the Finals MVP, following the Thunder's win in Game 7.

title: Pacers lose Haliburton to Achilles injury in Game 7
content: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton was helped off the court in the first quarter of Game 7 with what his father told ESPN is an Achilles injury.

title: Sources: Durant to Rockets in blockbuster trade
content: The Suns have agreed to trade Kevin Durant to the Rockets for Jalen Green, Dillon Brooks, the No. 10 pick in this year's draft and five second-round picks, sources told ESPN.

title: LSU chases Coastal, wins 2nd MCWS in 3 years
content: LSU knocked previously unbeaten Coastal Carolina ace Jacob Morrison out of the game with a four-run fourth inning, and the Tigers won their second national championship in three years Sunday with a 5-3 victory in the Men's College World Series finals.

title: Poch awed by U.S. leader Tillman: 'What a player'
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino said he was pleased to see his team deliver a "professional performance" in defeating Haiti 2-1 in the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Lukas in hospital, won't return to training horses
content: Hall of Famer D. Wayne Lukas, 89, has been hospitalized and won't return to training horses. His horses have been transferred to assistant Sebastian "Bas" Nicholl.

title: Brady wins inaugural Fanatics Games, $1M prize
content: Tom Brady emerged Sunday as the winner of the inaugural Fanatics Games, which pitted athletes and celebrities against fans in eight competitions this weekend at Fanatics Fest in New York.

title: 📈 Final NBA draft big board: Top 100 prospects
content: Who made big jumps in the top 10? Where do the Duke, Rutgers players rank? Here's our final top 100 big board.

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: USMNT completes 'perfect' group stage that was anything but
content: Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT made it three-for-three in the Gold Cup group stage, but there is clearly plenty still to work on for the Americans.

title: Club World Cup updates: Echeverri shows he can shine for City
content: Claudio Echeverri's 45-minute cameo has given Pep Guardiola plenty to think about, while Xabi Alonso got his first win as Real Madrid coach. Here's what you need to know from Sunday's Club World Cup action.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m.

title: Costa Rica draws with Mexico, meets U.S. in last 8
content: Mexico drew 0-0 with Costa Rica on Sunday night at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas to win Group A of the CONCACAF Gold Cup and will play Saudi Arabia in the quarterfinals.

title: Source: Pogba to join Monaco on two-year deal
content: Former Manchester United and Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba will sign for Ligue 1 side AS Monaco, a source told ESPN.

title: Bellingham loving 'amazing' Alonso ideas for Real
content: Jude Bellingham praised Xabi Alonso's "amazing ideas" after Real Madrid overcame an early red card to beat Pachuca 3-1 in the Club World Cup on Sunday, while confirming that he'll undergo shoulder surgery when the tournament is over.

title: Echeverri, Cherki score 1st City goals in CWC romp
content: Ilkay Gundogan scored two goals as Manchester City comfortably dispatched Emirati club Al Ain 6-0 on Sunday to ease into the knockout stage of the Club World Cup from Group G along with Juventus.

title: Miami, on brink of knockouts, overcoming 'doubts'
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said the club continues to defy expectations at the Club World Cup after the 2-1 victory over FC Porto in its second group stage game, despite critics doubting the team's abilities ahead of the tournament.

title: Three dead, 70 injured in Algeria stadium fall
content: Three spectators died and more than 70 others were injured after falling from the upper stand of a stadium following MC Alger's Algerian top-flight title win.

title: Deco: Williams shows 'strong desire' to join Barça
content: Barcelona sporting director Deco has said that Spain winger Nico Williams is "showing a strong desire" to make the move to the Camp Nou.

title: What gives MLB's best teams their edge? Every current playoff contender's biggest strength
content: For clubs currently leading the postseason hunt, here's the one thing most driving their success so far.

title: Passan: How the Red Sox 'absolutely botched' the Devers divorce
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: 'Awesome feeling': Chase Briscoe edges Denny Hamlin at Pocono
content: Chase Briscoe, driving the No. 19 Toyota, returned to victory lane on Sunday at Pocono Raceway, conserving fuel down the stretch to hold off Joe Gibbs Racing teammate Denny Hamlin for his first win with his new race team, and his first overall since 2024.

title: Three trades to help Boston avoid its impending financial crunch
content: The Celtics face an offseason of uncertainty. Here are their options ahead of the draft, including three big trades.

title: Five storylines, 12 players and one defining NBA offseason coming up
content: Here are the biggest stories this offseason. And how they resolve could dramatically impact next season.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: Okamoto: Jon Jones' MMA résumé isn't ruined by not fighting Tom Aspinall
content: No, the last chapter of Jon Jones' UFC career doesn't negate his legacy, yet it does add a "but" to the end.

title: Who are the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class? We picked the top five at every position
content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal balk at Sesko's wage demands
content: Benjamin Sesko's wage demands have reportedly sent Arsenal back to the drawing board. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Video: Israel Attacks Iran Airfields, Destroys F-14 Jet, Missile Storage Sites
content: The Israeli military said it carried out air strikes on at least six airports in western, eastern and central Iran and destroyed at least six Iranian airfields.

title: Homeland Security Warns Of "Heightened Threat" In US After Strikes On Iran
content: The Department of Homeland Security issued a warning, stating that there is a potential for violence and cyberattacks.

title: Andhra Man Found Dead Month After Wedding, Family Blames 'Wife's Affair'
content: Weeks after Raja Raghuvanshi's chilling murder on honeymoon, a man in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool has been found dead a month after his wedding, and his newlywed wife and her mother have been detained

title: Opinion: Opinion | What If Trump Has Just Started Another 'Forever War'?
content: Khamenei's political legitimacy rests on his ability to stand up to the 'Great Satan', the US. While America may not be targeting the regime directly, these attacks are a challenge to him, which he won't be able to let go of without a response

title: Global Warming Clouds Changes Are Making Earth More Even Hotter: Study
content: At any given time, about two-thirds of Earth's surface is covered by clouds. Overall, they make the planet much cooler than it would be without them.

title: Fire Breaks Out On 'Anupamaa' Set In Mumbai's Film City
content: A fire broke out early Monday morning at the set of the popular television show 'Anupamaa' in Film City, Goregaon East, Mumbai. The fire originated in a tent behind the Marathi Bigg Boss set.

title: Bengal Family Declares Daughter 'Dead' After Her Interfaith Marriage
content: The family of a young woman, who eloped and married a man of a different religion, performed the 'shradh' ceremony of their living daughter in West Bengal's Nadia district.

title: Assembly Bypoll Result 2025 Live Updates: AAP Leads In Gujarat's Visavadar, Trinamool In Bengal
content: The Assembly bypolls were held for two seats in Gujarat's Visavadar and Kadi, and one each in Kerala's Nilambur, Punjab's Ludhiana West, and West Bengal's Kaliganj.

title: US War Powers Act: Can The President Declare War Alone
content: Until President Donald Trump confirmed that the United States carried out "very successful" strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities.

title: Trump Says Iran Nuclear Sites "Obliterated". Satellite Pics Raise Questions
content: Trump's decision to order US forces to attack three key Iranian nuclear installations may have sabotaged the Islamic Republic's known atomic capabilities, but it's also created a monumental new challenge to work out what's left and where.

title: Rain, Thunderstorms Expected In Delhi Today, Yellow Alert Issued
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert for Delhi on Monday, warning of evening rain, thunderstorms and winds up to 40 kmph. The max Temperature is expected to be 36 degree Celsius.  AQI at satisfactory level.

title: Odisha River Flows Over Danger Mark After Heavy Rain, Many Villages Flooded
content: Authorities have issued an alert as the water level in the Subarnarekha river in Odisha's Balasore district has crossed the danger mark, creating a flood threat.

title: "Not Fit To Fly, Go Stitch Shoes": IndiGo Pilot Alleges Casteism At Work
content: Alleging casteist insults at work, a trainee pilot with IndiGo has accused three senior officials of telling him that he was "not fit to fly a plane" and "must stitch shoes" instead

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: Tehran Vows Retaliation As Israeli Strikes Kill 950 Iranians, US On Alert
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: The United States carried out a "very successful attack" on three nuclear sites in Iran, President Donald Trump said.

title: "To Get Elected...": Trump's 2011 Obama Post Surfaces After US Bombs Iran
content: In a 2011 video now viral on X, Trump claimed Obama had "no ability to negotiate", further suggesting the President would launch a war against Iran to maintain his position of power.

title: FedEx Founder Fred Smith, Who Revolutionised Package Delivery, Dies At 80
content: Fred Smith, the FedEx Corp founder who revolutionised the express delivery industry, has died, the company said. He was 80.

title: Iran Asks For Emergency Meeting Of UN Security Council Over US Strikes
content: Iran's ambassador to the United Nations called on Sunday for an emergency Security Council meeting for what he described as America's "heinous attacks and illegal use of force" against Iran.

title: "Opened A Pandora's Box": Russia Slams US For Iran Strike At UNSC
content: Russia's Ambassador to the United Nations, Vassily Nebenzia, sharply criticised the United States for its recent military strikes on Iran, accusing Washington of opening a "Pandora's box" with potentially catastrophic consequences for global security

title: Blood Splash On Walls Of Damascus Church After Suicide Bomber Kills 20
content: At the blood-stained Saint Elias church in Damascus, Umm George wept as she desperately searched for her son, who was among the worshippers when a suicide bomber struck on Sunday.

title: Oil Prices Jump, Asian Markets Dip As Middle East Crisis Escalates
content: Asian markets plunged while oil prices briefly hit five-month highs on Monday as investors anxiously awaited Tehran's next move after the United States joined Israel in attacking Iran's nuclear facilities, escalating the Middle East crisis.
